subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Unicode proposal, yet again.
msgSnippet: ... No one seems to have responded. I entered this group too late to really comment, thought I have looked over the archives. Getting our own unicode set would
messageBody:
amd64_hacker wrote:
>
>
> Have you had a chance to cast your eye over it yet?
> I'd really like to get the proposal posted, its icon is starting to
> glare at me.
> We've had two or three eyes on it so I think this is more or less what
> we want.
> I'm still a bit worried that I may have made it too essay-like, what do
> you think?
>

No one seems to have responded. I entered this group too late to really
comment, thought I have looked over the archives. Getting our own
unicode set would really help everyone--especially me right now, who is
making a font.

This is probably too late and probably not a suggestion you welcome, but
I prefer the revised names (Bob instead of Bay, Zhivago instead of Jai,
etc.) If we get Unicode approval, the rather inferior original names
will become official.

Thanks for all your work. Have you already submitted the proposal?

Paul
